marketNews.title: TLKM 2024: Net Profit -4% YoY, In Line with Expectations
marketNews.content:
Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) recorded net profit of IDR 5.9 trillion in 4Q24 (+18% YoY, +1% QoQ). This result makes the net profit for 2024 total IDR 23.6 trillion (-4% YoY), in line with expectations (99% of the 2024F consensus estimate). 

1. Stable subscriber base, quarterly ARPU increase
Operationally, TLKM reported 159.4 million mobile subscribers in 4Q24 (+0% YoY, +1% QoQ), with an average revenue per user (ARPU) of IDR 44,000 (-5% YoY, +2% QoQ). Although down year-on-year, this marks the first quarterly increase in mobile ARPU since its peak at IDR 49.7 thousand in 2Q23. The quarterly ARPU rise is a positive signal for telecom operators amid intense price-war dynamics in 2024. 

On the broadband side, subscriber count rose in 4Q24 (+8% YoY, +1% QoQ), while ARPU fell to IDR 233,000 (-6% YoY, -1% QoQ). The broadband ARPU decline is likely due to fixed-mobile convergence (FMC) strategies and/or tight price competition in the fixed-broadband segment. 

2. Operating profit fell quarterly due to higher marketing costs
Despite operational metrics improving quarter-over-quarter, TLKM’s operating profit in 4Q24 fell to IDR 10 trillion (+1% YoY, -6% QoQ), mainly because marketing expenses rose to IDR 1.3 trillion (+38% YoY, +36% QoQ) driven by a customer loyalty program. This brings 2024 operating profit to IDR 42.4 trillion (-6% YoY), slightly below expectations (97% of the 2024F consensus). Marketing expense ratio stayed at 2.6% of total revenue, consistent with the historical 2-3% range. 

TLKM also recorded a fair-value gain on investments of IDR 664 billion in 4Q24 (vs. 3Q24 gain of IDR 381 billion; 4Q23 loss of IDR 566 billion), bringing total 2024 gain from this item to IDR 188 billion (vs. 2023 loss of IDR 748 billion). 

3. Potential dividend yield 6.5-7.4%
Assuming a dividend payout ratio of 70-80% – based on projections from various media – TLKM could distribute a 2024 dividend of IDR 167-191 per share, equivalent to a dividend yield of about 6.5-7.4% based on the Monday (21/4) closing price of IDR 2,570 per share. TLKM plans to hold its AGM on 27 May 2025 to set the 2024 dividend. 

Key Takeaway
In the earnings call on Monday (21/4), TLKM management targeted low-single-digit revenue growth in 2025 (vs. 2024 actual +0.5% YoY), an EBITDA margin of about 50-52% (vs. 2024 actual 50%) and capex-to-sales of 17-19% (vs. 2024 actual 16.3%). For comparison, Indosat (ISAT) targets stronger revenue growth than the market in 2025 (vs. 2024 +9% YoY), higher EBITDA margin (vs. 2024 47%) and capex of IDR 13 trillion (vs. 2024 IDR 9.9 trillion). We assess TLKM’s 2025 targets as relatively realistic given industry trends and consumer purchasing power. Both TLKM and ISAT targets align with consensus forecasts (2025F TLKM: +3.8% YoY, 2025F ISAT: +5% YoY) and higher EBITDA margins (2025F TLKM: 52%, 2025F ISAT: 48%). 

Using the guidance from TLKM and ISAT, we judge that telecom operators will likely adopt a wait-and-see stance in 2025 and await the impact of the EXCL-FREN merger before pursuing more aggressive growth. Nonetheless, we see TLKM’s quarterly ARPU growth and current operator consolidation as signs that the sector is moving toward a more positive outlook (the worst is over).

marketNews.title: CTRA: Marketing Sales Down 5% YoY in 1Q25
marketNews.content: Ciputra Development recorded marketing sales of IDR 3.16 trillion in 1Q25 (-5% YoY, +35% QoQ), representing 29% of the 2025 target of IDR 11 trillion. The largest contribution came from the ‘Rumah dan Tanah Kavling’ segment (90.9%), followed by ‘Ruko’ (6.7%), ‘Apartemen’ (1.7%) and ‘Perkantoran’ (0.7%). Approximately 44% of 1Q25 marketing sales came from products eligible for PPN DTP.

marketNews.title: ACES: Same-Store Sales Growth +8.6% YoY in March 2025
marketNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia reported same-store sales growth (SSSG) of +8.6% YoY in March 2025 (vs. Feb 2025 –6.6% YoY, Mar 2024 +19.9% YoY), supporting a 1Q25 SSSG increase of +2.2% YoY (vs. 1Q24 +13.2%), beating the 2025 target of >+1% YoY. In March 2025, SSSG grew across all regions: Java outside Jakarta +9.8% YoY, outside Java +8.7% YoY, Jakarta +5.8% YoY.

marketNews.title: MAPI: 4Q24 Same-Store Sales Growth Flat at 0% YoY
marketNews.content: Mitra Adiperkasa posted same-store sales growth (SSSG) of 0% YoY in 4Q24 (vs. 3Q24 +0.2% YoY, 4Q23 –0.9% YoY). This resulted in a 2024 SSSG of +0.1% YoY (vs. 2023 +7.1% YoY). In 4Q24, the ‘Active’ segment under Map Aktif Adiperkasa (MAPA) grew +3% YoY, while the ‘Retail/Specialty Stores’ segment grew +1.5% YoY. The ‘Café & Restaurant’ segment under Map Boga Adiperkasa (MAPB) recorded a –15% YoY decline (vs. 3Q24 –25% YoY, 4Q23 –18.2% YoY).

marketNews.title: CMRY: 2024 Dividend of ~IDR 150 per Share (≈3.6% Yield)
marketNews.content: Cisarua Mountain Dairy will distribute a 2024 dividend of approximately IDR 1.2 trillion or IDR 150 per share, corresponding to a ~78% dividend payout ratio. The cum-date is the regular market and the settlement date is 9 May 2025. Using the Monday (21/4) closing price of IDR 4,120 per share, the implied dividend yield is about 3.6%.

marketNews.title: ADHI: New Contract Value IDR 2 Trillion in 1Q25 (-64% YoY)
marketNews.content: Adhi Karya’s corporate secretary Rozi Sparta said the company recorded new contract value of IDR 2 trillion in 1Q25 (-64% YoY), covering only about 7.1-8% of the 2025 target range of IDR 25-28 trillion.

marketNews.title: EXCL: Government Orders XLSmart to Build 8,000 New BTS Over Two Years
marketNews.content: Communications and Digital Minister Meutya Hafid claimed the government has mandated XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera to build 8,000 new base transceiver stations (BTS) within two years. Failure to meet the requirement could trigger administrative sanctions up to licence revocation. EXCL’s Chairman Arsjad Rasjid affirmed the company’s commitment to fulfil all government-imposed obligations.

marketNews.title: PTRO: 2024 Dividend of US$10 Million (IDR 16.36 per Share, ~0.7% Yield)
marketNews.content: Petrosea shareholders approved a dividend for the 2024 financial year of US$10 million or IDR 16.36 per share, based on an assumed USD/IDR rate of 16,500. The cum-date and payment date have not been announced. Using the Monday (21/4) closing price of IDR 2,310 per share, the implied dividend yield is about 0.7%.

marketNews.title: DXY Slides to 97.93 as Trump-Powell Rumor Spreads
marketNews.content: The U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) fell to a six-month low of 97.93 on Monday (21/4) after rumors that President Donald Trump is considering removing Fed Chair Jerome Powell. The comment followed a statement by National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett on Friday (18/4) that Trump is studying whether he can fire Powell. Hassett’s remark came a day after Trump publicly criticized Powell for not cutting rates quickly enough.

marketNews.title: Indonesia and U.S. Seek to Finalise Trade-Investment Deal in 60 Days
marketNews.content: Indonesia’s Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said Indonesia and the United States aim to complete a trade and investment partnership within 60 days. He said Indonesia expects its top 20 exports to the U.S.—including textiles, furniture and shrimp—to receive balanced, non-higher-than-peers tariffs, while offering cooperation on critical minerals and horticultural import deregulation. A meeting with U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent is scheduled for the week.

marketNews.title: China-Indonesia Vow to Counter Unilateralism and Protect Trade
marketNews.content: China’s Foreign Minister Wang Yi said China and Indonesia must jointly oppose all forms of unilateralism and trade protectionism, and should accelerate regional economic integration while safeguarding industrial and supply-chain stability. The comment followed a meeting between the two governments in Beijing on Monday (21/4).

marketNews.title: China Warns Against Bilateral Deals That Undermine Its Interests
marketNews.content: China’s Ministry of Commerce accused the United States of tariff abuse and warned other countries not to strike broader economic deals with the U.S. China warned it would take firm retaliatory measures if such deals occur.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Trade Surplus Expands to US$4.33 Billion in March 2025
marketNews.content: BPS reported that Indonesia’s trade surplus reached US$4.33 billion in March 2025 (vs. US$4.58 billion in Mar 2024, US$3.12 billion in Feb 2025), beating the consensus estimate of US$2.64 billion. Export growth was +3.16% YoY (consensus –3.4% YoY) while imports rose +5.34% YoY (consensus +6.6% YoY).

marketNews.title: BI Deputy Governor Says Indonesia Open to QRIS Cooperation with Any Country
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia’s Deputy Governor Destry Damayanti said the central bank is open to cooperating with any country—including the United States—on QRIS usage, provided both sides are ready. The comment came after QRIS was listed as a trade barrier by the U.S. Trade Representative, which also highlighted the National Payment Gateway as a barrier.

marketNews.title: LG-Led Consortium Pulls Out of $7.7 Billion Indonesian EV Battery Project
marketNews.content: South Korean news agency Yonhap reported that a consortium led by LG withdrew from a $7.7 billion electric-vehicle battery supply-chain project in Indonesia, a project that had partnered with the Indonesian government and state-owned enterprises. LG will continue its existing EV battery plant with Hyundai Motor Group in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Pope Francis Passes Away at Age 88
marketNews.content: Pope Francis died at age 88, according to a statement from the Vatican on Monday (21/4).
